Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the regulation of outdoor advertising and repealing sections 5, 6, 7 and 8 of local law 14 for the year 2001 in relation thereto.
AND SUCH OTHER BUSINESS AS MAY BE NECESSARY

Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application no. 040443 ZMM, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter, concerning changes to the zoning map, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 9.

Uniform land use review procedure application no. 040445 ZSM, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the Charter of the City of New York concerning a special permit under the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 9 to allow a public parking garage with a capacity of over 369.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called-up by vote of the Council

Uniform land use review procedure application no. 040444 ZSM, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the Charter of the City of New York concerning a special permit under the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 9 to allow to modify the height and set back regulations of 33-43 and the tower regulations of 33-45.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to civil penalties for failure to maintain landmark or historic district improvements.
Items.MatterName: Allowing civil penalties for neglect of a landmark site or a site within a historic district.

Items.Title: Application no. 20045643 TCM, pursuant to §20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of 999 Restaurant Corp., d/b/a Nello’s, to establish, maintain and operate an unenclosed small sidewalk café located at 696 Madison Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 4.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Café located at 696 Madison Ave, Manhattan, CD#4 (20045643TCM)

Items.Title: Application no. 20055061 TCM, pursuant to §20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of Poupetto, Inc., d/b/a Le Bilboquet, to establish, maintain and operate an unenclosed small sidewalk café located at 23 East 65th Street, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 4.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Café, 23 East 65th Street, Manhattan, CD#4 (20055061TCM)
